header: Consider the logical scheme presented in the figure. Which of the following queries allows you to indicate payments over ‘5’ made by customers ‘1’ and ‘5’?

body.answer: SELECT Customer_Id, Amount FROM Payment WHERE Customer_Id = 1 OR Id=5 AND Amount > =5;
SELECT Customer_Id, Amount FROM Payment WHERE Customer_Id IN (1,5) AND Amount > 5;
SELECT DISTINCT Customer_Id, Amount FROM Payment WHERE Customer_Id IN (1,5) AND Amount > 5;
SELECT Customer_Id, Amount FROM Payment WHERE Customer_Id IN (1,5) AND Amount NOT <= 5;
None of the above.

source: Belo, O., Cadernos de Problemas - Sistemas de Bases de Dados, Departamento de Informática, Escola de Engenharia, Universidade do Minho, 2019

header: Consider the logical scheme presented in the figure. Which of the following queries allows you to indicate the names of the cities appearing in the addresses of customer ‘Josefino Cunha’?

body.answer: a) SELECT CL.First_Name, CL.Last_Name, CI.City FROM Customer AS CL INNER JOIN City AS CI ON CL.Customer_Id = CI.Address_Id INNER JOIN Address AS AD ON AD.City_Id = CI.City_Id WHERE CL.First_Name = 'Josefino'  AND  CL.Last_Name = 'Cunha';
b) SELECT CL.First_Name, CL.Last_Name, CI.City FROM Customer AS CL, Address AS AD, City AS CI WHERE CL.First_Name = 'Josefino'  AND CL.Last_Name = 'Cunha';

c) SELECT CL.First_Name, CL.Last_Name, CI.City FROM Customer AS CL INNER JOIN Address AS AD  ON CL.Customer_Id = AD.Address_Id  INNER JOIN City AS CI ON AD.City_Id = CI.City_Id WHERE CL.First_Name = 'Josefino'  AND  CL.Last_Name = 'Cunha';
None of the above.
